cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest, then north, toward the North Carolina coast Friday night and through eastern Virginia and the mid-Atlantic this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central North Carolina coast (near Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC; Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point; Tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach; remainder Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds (Storm Surge Watch areas)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Duck NC to Chincoteague VA including Chesapeake Bay south of Windmill Point, Neuse & Pamlico Rivers, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds (Storm Surge); Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and mid-Atlantic coastline from Cape Fear NC northward to Delaware Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–47 kt) possible Saturday with a 20 % cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds; gusts could be higher.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible in Chesapeake Bay south of Colonial Beach, including the Norfolk/Hampton Roads area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated amounts up to 7 inches likely Friday night through Saturday, causing urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal erosion, and a low risk of brief tornadoes Friday night–Saturday.
